function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of virtual reality for healthcare education may not accurately replicate real-world medical scenarios, leading to gaps in knowledge and skills.","Impact":"Ineffective training of medical staff, potential misdiagnosis or mistreatment of patients, compromised patient safety.","Mitigation":"Supplement virtual reality training with real-world practical experience and mentorship, validate virtual reality simulations against real-world scenarios.","Technologies":"Simulated virtual reality training platforms, augmented reality overlays for real-world validation.","People":"Medical staff, patients","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, medical educators"},{"Description":"Inadequate adoption and implementation of virtual reality technology in healthcare education due to infrastructure limitations or resistance to change.","Impact":"Missed opportunities for improving healthcare service efficiency and accuracy, limited access to advanced training for medical staff.","Mitigation":"Invest in infrastructure for virtual reality training, provide incentives for healthcare institutions and staff to adopt virtual reality technology, offer comprehensive training and support.","Technologies":"Virtual reality hardware and software, network infrastructure for data transmission.","People":"Healthcare administrators, IT departments, medical educators","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, government health agencies"},{"Description":"Potential ethical challenges in the use of virtual reality for medical education, such as privacy concerns and appropriate use of patient data in simulations.","Impact":"Risk of unauthorized access to patient data, violation of patient privacy, ethical issues related to the use of patient information in simulations.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data security measures, obtain informed consent for use of patient data in virtual reality simulations, adhere to ethical guidelines and regulations for use of patient information.","Technologies":"Secure data encryption, data anonymization, patient consent management systems.","People":"Medical staff, patients, data privacy experts","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, data protection authorities"}]}
